title: Perseus
creator: Rahmi, Hanna Mikaîl
description: Hanna Mikaîl Rahmi presented his work to HRH Augusta Victoria, Empress of Germany, in 1903. Text of handwritten notes regarding the Empress are: “This work is dedicated to the ever shining name of Her August and Imperial Majesty Augusta Victoria of Germany” and “This book has been with Her August Majesty, Augusta Victoria, Empress of Germany for about five months. Mostly likely she and the Imperial family often handled it; she has read it through, otherwise she would not have asked for a printed copy. 27/11/1903.”
subject: English literature -- Arab authors; Perseus (Greek mythology); Mythology in literature; Auguste Viktoria, Empress, consort of William II, German Emperor, 1858-1921
collection: Rare Books and Special Collections Library; The American Univeristy in Cairo
repository: Rare Books and Special Collections Digital Library
